website_summaries.verdict: This set is smaller than the deluxe design, but has a nice tin storage box.
pros: Putty included to help stabilize the wheels for your designs
A compact size with a sturdy carry case
Can be used with any ballpoint pens
cons: The plastic in this set is flimsier than you might remember from the original

customer_reviews.title: I swear I pretended to buy this for my kid!
customer_reviews.text: I, um, bought this for my kid. Yup. Mostly. Ok, buy it for yourself but say its for your kid and hope they don't really care and think your a geezer for liking it, and then it's all yours!
customer_reviews.author: Goldie

customer_reviews.title: Great value and a great retro treat for your kids!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely loved playing with these as a kid and was so happy to find a small set to introduce it to my own kids. My daughter absolutely loves it! The only issue is that the kit is very small. The paper is very thin and not large enough use, so plan to buy larger paper for the move complex designs. There’s a larger kit here which is more expensive, but a better alternative if you want a bigger kit as a gift idea:
customer_reviews.author: Thomas & Jessii

customer_reviews.title: like the full size set sold in stores
customer_reviews.text: Extremely tiny.Was expecting something much bigger..like the full size set sold in stores..Not what I expected at all,very small,and reminds me of travel size version.cute but too small for 13 to 20.00 when the big version can be purchased in the store for less
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I discovered that the top of the blue pen was not attached and the pen was dried up and useless. I contacted customer service (h
customer_reviews.text: When I opened the sealed box, I discovered that the top of the blue pen was not attached and the pen was dried up and useless. I contacted customer service (hoping they would replace the pen) and the representative told me to contact Hasbro and then ended out chat session. I contacted Hasbro, but as yet have not heard back. Product delivers in that it's cool and just like the one I had as a kid, but shoddy customer service always dampens my enthusiasm.
customer_reviews.author: S. Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Fun, small. Wish it was bigger. Good quality. Come in nice storage tin.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for kids because I remembered having one as a child. This is great quality. Comes in a nice tin. 4 stars because it is smaller than I expected/wanted. I was hoping for a bigger circle for my younger kids to be able to handle better. But it's still very nice. Comes with sticky puddy to hold the main parts in place. Which is cool and works well even on thin paper. Nostalgic fun, worth getting. In the picture with it open, I took everything out of inner plastic casing so the tin would hold other things.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: Nostalgia!!
customer_reviews.text: Saw these for much more money at a local store. Checked Amazon and low and behold a great price to be found. The same fun it's always been and a great gift for my kids who had no idea what Spirograph was. It's smaller than it looks but a great stocking stuffer or small gift for a childs birthday.
customer_reviews.author: Mars13

customer_reviews.title: Great travel size spirograph
customer_reviews.text: Great travel size spirograph! My 6 year old and 4 year old love it and they are quickly getting the hang of it! My only complaint is with the sticky putty, when it's used to hold down the outer ring, it seems to elevate that ring too much and make the inner ring slip underneath it and not be able to do the design smoothly. My kids get very frustrated with it. Using less doesn't seem to help much either. Usually I just help them out and hold down the outer ring with my hand for them. Otherwise, fun toy!
customer_reviews.author: Kelly L. Bebla

customer_reviews.title: Extremely small
customer_reviews.text: I felt that this was a bit misleading as it is a fraction of the size it appears and doesn't include much. I thought it was a bit much to pay for this as there are larger and nicer sets for a fraction of the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: very small
customer_reviews.text: I'm disappointed with this. I think I could have gotten the bigger one for the same price elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Karri Fieglein

customer_reviews.title: Cheap!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Was very disappointed in this product, it is very small and very cheaply made. I bought it for a present but would be embarrassed to give it to anyone. Sending it back! I don’t know how it got so many stats!
customer_reviews.author: Penny T

customer_reviews.title: Giftable and should be fun!
customer_reviews.text: This was a Christmas gift for our son. He played with it for about 10 minutes Christmas morning, and lost interest quickly. He hasn't revisited it yet. Not really sure why he doesn't seem to care for it. It comes in a keepable tin and all the parts have their own places. It is a nice set, really.
customer_reviews.author: Smiley Mommy

customer_reviews.title: Love this classic item! It’s makes a great gift.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Spirograph for my 5 year old granddaughter and she loves it. It might be a little advanced for her, but she is loving figuring it out. I especially love the packaging, very effective and efficient. I had one as a child and LOVED it. I’m so glad to see that classics never go out of style.
customer_reviews.author: P. King

customer_reviews.title: Great activity for young and old.
customer_reviews.text: As always, a great creative toy and activity for the young and the old. Bought this for my son for Christmas and he used it for months and months. I still have spirograph designs under magnets on my refrigerator. Fast shipping. I would have no hesitancy to do business with this company again in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Kats

customer_reviews.title: did not come with tacks to hold the circles down
customer_reviews.text: It was a miniature very small set for the price I paid. I thought it was a full size spirograph. Did not include the cardboard and the tack to hold the cirlces down either. Way overpriced for such a miniture spirograph.
customer_reviews.author: Vicki Stinnett

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good, could be better...
customer_reviews.text: This spirograph set is really cool and fun. It has a lot of design wheels that make cool designs. It is very much like the one I had when I was a kid. My 9 year old stepdaughter loves it! My only complaint is that this kit does not come with a frame to hold the wheels and sometimes she has trouble making the designs. There is another kit that does have the frame included for a little more money. I would probably choose that kit over this one. However, this kit would probably be great for older kids. Pretty good, overall!
customer_reviews.author: Nurse Ratched

customer_reviews.title: LOVE it! Awe
customer_reviews.text: LOVE it! Awe, the memories of 80/90s drawing. We all thought we were so cool with this set. I had to get it for my daughters. They love it too. We sit and draw all sorts of designs. It comes in a small set that can be easily carried in a book bag to school. This item was worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah C. Hervert

customer_reviews.title: Cheap quality. Disappointing!
customer_reviews.text: My husband saw this on Amazon and immediately wanted to get it because it reminded him of how he used to love playing with these as a child. I vaguely remember playing with these too although I was not a huge fan. Once we opened the package we were very disappointed. The quality of the plastic was very flimsy and cheap looking. It really didn't resemble the Spirograph toys that we used to play with as kids. Husband still wants to keep it for the memory sake but wouldn't recommend. It's really not functional. He will just be mainly keeping it in the box.
customer_reviews.author: ApplesandpaintTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I’m currently trying to tap into the otherwise neglected creative side of my brain, so I wanted a smaller set of these to try out, and I am completely satisfied with this purchase. I accidentally stepped on the tin so it no longer closes, but everything inside was fine, which I was extremely grateful for. The tin is very easy and convenient to travel with; I just throw it in my book bag when I’m off to class.
customer_reviews.author: Claire Rorick

customer_reviews.title: Blast from the past
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves to play with this. However, the sticky tac they provide to secure the spirograph to the paper is outdated and tricky to use. It doesn't stay sticky that long. They need to come up with a different way to secure the pieces to the paper.
customer_reviews.author: ACASSIDY

customer_reviews.title: Great to Include in Operation Christmas Child Shoebox
customer_reviews.text: I purchased three of these to include in Operation Christmas Child Shoeboxes for 10-14 year old children. I think the receiving children will be thrilled and get hours of creative use with them. These are like the classics originals just a little smaller. I recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Blessings in a Shoebox

customer_reviews.title: I feel like a kid again.
customer_reviews.text: It's a great set for the price. It offers a nice instruction booklet to explain how to create certain designs or you can just start putting one cog in and drawing to your heart's content. It does have a bit of a learning curve keeping the cogs in without having them jump around. It definitely brought me back to grade school and was a great purchase and addition to have in the house during this time of staying at home.
customer_reviews.author: Dawnyal Hill

customer_reviews.title: I think she'll like it!
customer_reviews.text: Looks like it'll be fun. It's smaller than I thought, the size of a book. I wish it had a few more bigger pieces and a bigger notebook to go with it.
customer_reviews.author: Ele R

customer_reviews.title: Was disappointed in what you get
customer_reviews.text: very small kit. Was disappointed in what you get. Love spirograph but you're better off buying a larger set
customer_reviews.author: Elaine Conradi

customer_reviews.title: I loved the idea of spirograph in a tin as I've ...
customer_reviews.text: Meh. I am partly to blame because I bought this without reading the details closely enough. I loved the idea of spirograph in a tin as I've always had problems with the cardboard box in the past. This kit is very small compared to spirographs of the past -- so few pieces. It really made me kind of sad. And while the tin is great albeit small, the interior plastic tray that holds the wheels is extremely flimsy. About the only thing I really liked about it was the putty. I donated it to the library.
customer_reviews.author: ShallowWit

customer_reviews.title: Not the same as it used to be.
customer_reviews.text: Well, they tried desperately to cheapen one of my favorite toys from childhood. But to keep the plastic stencils in place all they give you is sticky tack, which doesn’t work well, and makes it too difficult for smaller children to use. I was disappointed and wouldn’t purchase again. My 5 year-old lost interest quickly because it was so difficult to use. Bummer.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Hill

customer_reviews.title: Not made the same as the old ones.
customer_reviews.text: They were very nostalgic k fun to play with. The putty does not work. Better to go the old route & use stick pins. Product was not as thick as the old ones. If you’ve never used it you will love it. If you used them as a kid you will be disappointed in the quality.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Mlcak

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work like it used to
customer_reviews.text: I had one of these when I was little, so I thought my daughter would have fun with it. It is extremely difficult to use. She gets very frustrated. I've tried it several times hoping I could figure out some tricks, but it just doesn't work well. Do not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Not very fancy

customer_reviews.title: Compact, nice container
customer_reviews.text: It was a gift, so I didn’t open or use it. I liked that it is compact and in a tin container. My sister loved it. Actually, everyone got a Spirograph included in their gift bag this year. Lol
customer_reviews.author: Eugenia Siza

customer_reviews.title: A classic
customer_reviews.text: I bought for my niece and she loves it. I had one when I was 10 years old and I enjoyed it. I wanted my niece to have the same experience and I think that she is having a blast with it. I recommend this for kids who enjoy to do drawings and science.
customer_reviews.author: Akire

customer_reviews.title: Nostalgic Game Modified
customer_reviews.text: I thought this was very cool!! The opportunity to share some of the games from our childhood. With that being said, I missed what all was included. The price did not fit. If you shop around you can find the complete set.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Pipp

customer_reviews.title: fun toy
customer_reviews.text: My 9 year old , my 12 year old, and my 14 year old love this. It comes with paper, and a stick of putty to keep the platinum ring held to the page.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wish teh tin came a bit larger.
customer_reviews.text: I also bought the larger set. Each went to two different households. I liked the tin for holding the materials, thinking the little plastic rings could get lost. I wanted the bigger set to have a nicer case or more convenient box. The smaller one was a bit too small for doing spirograph pics but if the child is older - this little one was only 5 - they could probably do better.
customer_reviews.author: CC

customer_reviews.title: A little over priced
customer_reviews.text: Its a great little creative toy for a small child but I think this is a little over priced at $9.98 for what you get. I would think around $6 would be appropriate for this item.
customer_reviews.author: denverdog

customer_reviews.title: Fun and beautiful projects await
customer_reviews.text: Super fun. This was purchased for school aged kids and they use it during free time. Fun to use and nostalgic. The kids love doing designs and making it colorful as well!
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Lacy Atomic

customer_reviews.title: Timeless fun!
customer_reviews.text: Had a set I played with at my grandmother's house growing up. Got these for my kids and they are still a hit. Some things can't be replaced by electronics. Came I'm a cute little tin and it keeps the kids distracted for hours
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Renee

customer_reviews.title: Love it. Love the case. Buy this one. Seriously.
customer_reviews.text: I finally know how to use this thing. I like that it is small, and comes in a tin case we can travel with. Keeps all the little pieces together. My OCD with perfect lines both loves and hates it!
customer_reviews.author: Bobbalicious

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: Upset over the low quality of this and it’s cheap as it gets.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A spirogragh for storing, not using
customer_reviews.text: This is not the spirograph of your youth. Takes four(4) hands to use. One set of adult hands to hold the main wheel and one set of kid hands to make the designs. Not really just a kids by themselves toy. The tin that it store in could have also used to hold the wheels while spinning the design. Stores well. Store small. This will see alot of storing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Overall happy, having fun with it
customer_reviews.text: Nice to get a cool toy and bonus that it's a classic. No pins in the set nowadays -- they supply sticky gum instead. And the rings are harder to use than I remembered. Still, my son loved getting it, and he's had fun making patterns with it. Watch out -- the box is a lot smaller than you might expect. Much smaller than the original sets. About the size of a lunchbox in height and width. In depth, a couple of inches.
customer_reviews.author: Puppet Girl

customer_reviews.title: Mini Set
customer_reviews.text: This is a small version of the original. The putty that comes with it is totally useless. I have to search for something more adequate to hold spirals in place.
customer_reviews.author: MMD

customer_reviews.title: Spirograph Design
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this Spirograph set for my 7 year old great niece for Christmas. She should have loads of fun with all the colorful designs she can make with the colorful pens. Comes in a sturdy tin box which is very durable and will last and stores all of her Spiro gear.
customer_reviews.author: Gail C.

customer_reviews.title: So fun!
customer_reviews.text: I had these as a kid and wanted them for my kids. My older two haven’t messed with them yet but my 4 year old LOVES this. They’re good quality and I like that they come with putty to hold down the pieces.
customer_reviews.author: Michael P

customer_reviews.title: swirls of fun
customer_reviews.text: I think this set is a bit overpriced for what it is, but it is a lot of fun. I had a spirograph set when I was a kid. This set: the plastic seems a little more flimsy or flexible than what I remember. I think my set (~30 years ago) was made of plastic that is a bit more brittle and stiff. I'm worried that the ring shaped piece might get bent and not lay flat and render the set unusable. But other than that, it is everything I remember. A little tricky to keep the gear-teeth in contact, so frustrating for little ones. My impatient 9 year old is struggling, but she'll master it eventually.
customer_reviews.author: Pixelle

customer_reviews.title: Small, simple kit, (not the full version you ...
customer_reviews.text: Small, simple kit, (not the full version you may remember from the days of old), but it's the right size to keep attention without presenting a billion bits to get spread around the room and lost.
customer_reviews.author: K. Jacobs

customer_reviews.title: Just as great as it was in the good old days
customer_reviews.text: Spirograph is truly timeless. I got this instead of an adult coloring book -- it does not disappoint. It is smaller than you might think it will be -- check the measurements in the product description. This particular version had everything I needed and wanted to get a Spirograph "fix" and some relaxation.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice spirograph set, but smaller than I expected.
customer_reviews.text: It's a sprigraph...you can make awesome pictures, just like when you were a kid. However, this set is fairly small. Comes in a tin case, which is nice.
customer_reviews.author: Pan

customer_reviews.title: Really small
customer_reviews.text: It was tiny and it only had a few parts. Probably my fault for not reading the entire description! Cut for a party prize, stocking stuffer etc.
customer_reviews.author: Tattooed grandma

customer_reviews.title: GOOD GIFT
customer_reviews.text: Gave these to my cousin's daughter for Christmas, she wasn't too excited about it but my cousin was! She might the one playing with this?!
customer_reviews.author: Marvin D. Martian

customer_reviews.title: So great!
customer_reviews.text: My child loves it! It comes with several pieces plus tack, instructions/ideas, and pens/paper to use. So great!
customer_reviews.author: Conscientious

customer_reviews.title: OMG!!! Awesome.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this and several other items to have on hand at my home for when my nephew comes to visit. This was his absolute favorite! He spent hours playing with this. Making notes to his teacher and mom. He now wants a bigger one with more wheels. The Spirograph included two pens a pad of papers several size wheels and a how to booklet. My nephew loved experimenting with different hole and wheels sizes and seeing what they could create . Very happy with this purchase and very happy with how it occupied my energetic nephew for at least an hour.
customer_reviews.author: BlueSkySpark

customer_reviews.title: Not good 4 younger kids
customer_reviews.text: This was fun for my 11 year old. My 5 and 9 y/o didnt get or understand it...my 11 y.o is in all advanced classes and had no problem creating by herself. SHE LOVED IT
customer_reviews.author: jaylee

customer_reviews.title: Nice Spirograph
customer_reviews.text: So much better than the paper boxes that they usually come in. There aren’t a ton of pieces, but there are enough to keep kids happy
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice gift
customer_reviews.text: I like the tin, and the pens it comes with write very smoothly. My only dislike is that you have to use sticky tack to hold pieces down on the paper. I’m not sure what I was expecting but I just don’t care for that. Otherwise it’s great!!
customer_reviews.author: Cassandra S.

customer_reviews.title: Fun to see the cool designs ot makes
customer_reviews.text: I forgot how hard this was to use. The puddy inside used for holding stencils down was worthless. It was way to hard even after kneading the puddy it really didnt soften much than turned hard as a rock.
customer_reviews.author: Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Highlight of the Yankee Swap!
customer_reviews.text: Took this to work for our Yankee Swap—it was a big hit! The packaging is perfect. And it's Spirograph. What more could anyone want?
customer_reviews.author: MissQuotable

customer_reviews.title: OK but not exciting
customer_reviews.text: My granddaughter enjoyed this for a couple of days before becoming frustrated because there are only two pen colors which ran out quickly and the paper is too small for most designs. She was also disappointed that her favorite designs with stars had no directions in the booklet. I got new pens and larger paper, and she had more fun. The case is good. I was surprised that the sticky tack stuff worked reasonably well. It is important to keep the pieces small and to stick them well around the ring.
customer_reviews.author: Cleo18

customer_reviews.title: I have been an avid fan of spyrograph since I was a little kid and this set is by far the worst made I have ever seen
customer_reviews.text: The plastic of the wheels is very flimsy and it makes you unable to complete one set of design without it flying off the big wheels. I have been an avid fan of spyrograph since I was a little kid and this set is by far the worst made I have ever seen.
customer_reviews.author: Sallouma

customer_reviews.title: Smaller than I had expected
customer_reviews.text: I loved the Spirograph, but it was much smaller than I had expected. I should have read the dimensions. I’m not certain if Iwould have purchased it, but my granddaughter loved it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A wave of nostalgia
customer_reviews.text: Product comes in a beautiful, slim, tin box for easy storage. Easy to follow instructions in the booklet. Fun to use. It brought back fond memories of my childhood. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Belinda

customer_reviews.title: Back to good days
customer_reviews.text: It was a lot smaller than I expected but it does not disappoint, easy for kids to learn to do and comes in a convenient tin case to keep them all together.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica W

customer_reviews.title: Tin case DENTED
customer_reviews.text: Several small dents on the small tin case - to the point the child could not open it until we fixed one of the dents at the hinges. The item is creative fun, BUT the tin case is very bad
customer_reviews.author: rewind

customer_reviews.title: Spirograph
customer_reviews.text: They were better built when I was a kid hard for 7&8 years old to do now compared to how they were made years ago. Bothered me more than the kids
customer_reviews.author: PENNY

customer_reviews.title: Great gift
customer_reviews.text: A hit amoungst the kids. Bought it twice, once for a 6 year old and one for a 10 year old. Enjoyed by both boy and girl. Small, compact, easy to travel with and the tin box is ideal.
customer_reviews.author: Beaverhausen

customer_reviews.title: retro toy!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect gift for our six year old niece! Will be so fun for her! Old school toy, one nice to see back around again!
customer_reviews.author: Tasha Rae

customer_reviews.title: Mini size
customer_reviews.text: This is mini not the size I thought it would be. Wouldn’t buy again. But if your looking for small then it’s perfect
customer_reviews.author: zookept

customer_reviews.title: He's Enjoying It as Much as I Did
customer_reviews.text: I enjoyed this "toy" when I was very young, (some time ago). I got this for our grandson this year. It even comes with pens! A package of 500 sheets of printing paper for a few dollars and what else do you need? It brought back some memories and tempted me to buy two.
customer_reviews.author: STAR STRUCKTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Perfect little set!
customer_reviews.text: Great set! It’s smaller than I expected but that can also be nice- compact. My 7 year old loves it!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Smaller then it looks but still a quality product
customer_reviews.text: The product is a bit smaller than it looks in the pictures, so that was a little disappointing but it doesn't fact have everything that advertises so.
customer_reviews.author: Mbear44

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Gave it to nieces and nephews for Christmas. It’s just like I remembered it from my childhood.
customer_reviews.author: M. Sotta

customer_reviews.title: Great Purchase!
customer_reviews.text: Had this when I was a kid and thought it was a lot of fun. Wanted my oldest granddaughter to have one because she really likes drawing. She loves it! I'll probably have to buy 2 more once the other to granddaughter's are old enough. Great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: So happy that I saw this one and purchased it
customer_reviews.text: My granddaughter informed me that she always wanted a splrograph ever since she saw one of her friends with one, something that I didn't know. So happy that I saw this one and purchased it. I thought that it would have been bigger and I kind of prefer the pins to hold the wheel in place rather than the puttty, but no big thing she truly loved it. I let her know that I had a spirograph when I was a little girl back in the early 60's and liked it then and still like it now, so we now have one more thing in common :-)
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Ali

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: This is for children the print is so fine you can't read it even with a magnifying glass
customer_reviews.author: Alana Beauregard

customer_reviews.title: Good kit for 7 y.o.
customer_reviews.text: 7 y.o. girl likes it. A little hard to use, but everything requires practice, so she needs to get the hang of it. These are not magical kit, so unless you are super talented, it won't make beautiful art work. Only some cordinated people can create cool perfect spirograph! not me or my girl!
customer_reviews.author: Hanna

customer_reviews.title: Great gift!
customer_reviews.text: Great gift for my daughters friend. Easy to use and have a small book with ideas. She's being using it everyday since Christmas day.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: It was great to see my grandsons eyes light up as he saw the designs it could make. Also great to see they still make quality toys that educate and entertain. Thank you so much
customer_reviews.author: Cowboy Up

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: This is a very disappointing product. I should have taken the negative reviews more seriously. If you are someone who had a spirograph from years past, this product will likely not be what you are thinking you are getting. It is hard to use. Wheels don't stay in place. There is some putty stuff to place a frame, but that system is cumbersome.
customer_reviews.author: PJK

customer_reviews.title: We've had endless hours of fun with it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for myself and my grandson. We've had endless hours of fun with it. What I really like, is instead of puncturing the paper with stabilizer bar they have included a putty to use. It works great keeping the discs stationary. No more holes...yipee!
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: IT'S A HIT
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for our Grand Daughter, for a Christmas Present bit of nostalgia. She loves it, only one downside to this review the picture leads you to believe its somewhat larger. It's like a travel size Spirograph, but she loves it and that's all that matters.
customer_reviews.author: Kenny Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: Small but very nice!
customer_reviews.text: Much smaller than expected. Was used as a birthday gift and was immediately opened and used by the 6 year old receiver.
customer_reviews.author: McLain

customer_reviews.title: Seems very expensive for what you get
customer_reviews.text: It's a tiny little tin box with almost nothing in it. Total disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Mom reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Nostalgia to share with grandsons
customer_reviews.text: I remember having this as a child, and wanted to share with the grandsons.
customer_reviews.author: Timmelmik

customer_reviews.title: In kid heaven again
customer_reviews.text: Loved these as a kid and this is the perfect size set to get started again!
customer_reviews.author: Katie Sarazine

customer_reviews.title: Entertaining
customer_reviews.text: This is a great travel size version of the classic Spirograph. All the pieces fit tightly into a plastic setting so you can easily repackage when your not using it. If you purchase the actual game in stores it does include more stencils that allow for more designs but if you are just looking for away to pass the time this is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: StephanieTop Contributor: Board Games

customer_reviews.title: A little on the cheep side
customer_reviews.text: The product is a little on the cheep side. I got this fro my kids to use. I haven't given it to them yet. The product seems harder than reasonable to use. The parts are cheaply made. They seem like they could break easily.
customer_reviews.author: Sherri Jene McLain

customer_reviews.title: Great set!
customer_reviews.text: My son loved it and wouldn’t leave it for days. In fact, the possibilities are endless if you really put your mind to it. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Natalie G

customer_reviews.title: Giftable tin case all in one box
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, cute giftable tin holder for it. Excited to show the kids all the cool shapes and designs
customer_reviews.author: Amber Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again
customer_reviews.text: Just like I remember it from playing as a kid. It comes with putty to place a big circle, then you out the smaller ones inside or outside that to make designs. Works with other pens beside the ones included. Fun product.
customer_reviews.author: D. Hoff

customer_reviews.title: An easy, interactive toy to grow with your child.
customer_reviews.text: It's a great compact childrens toy to take on trips as well as a counter top toy aftet school while snacking.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Just like we had as kids.
customer_reviews.text: Will be a great Christmas gift for my son. Who didn’t love these things when they were a kid? This one comes in a nice slim tin case; perfect for travel.
customer_reviews.author: Flux Capacitor

customer_reviews.title: Memories!
customer_reviews.text: I love that our 14 year old twins spent hours off and on over Christmas break with this! They were far more excited than I expected them to be... and I love they they are enjoying it just as I did so many many years ago!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Zville Kim

customer_reviews.title: Great Christmas gift for a 10 year old
customer_reviews.text: My sister and I loved these growing up. I got this for my niece and it was a hit for a Christmas gift. Shes very creative and I'm glad she liked it. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: carlos garcia

customer_reviews.title: It is a bit too flimsy to work easily.
customer_reviews.text: Didn't work as well as I had hoped. Thus, not used all that much.
customer_reviews.author: gpdooby

customer_reviews.title: Memories
customer_reviews.text: It brought back childhoods memories. That's why I bought it
customer_reviews.author: Adriana G.

customer_reviews.title: Old School Toys Rule
customer_reviews.text: This classic is still amazing. Sure, you could do this on computer, but there is something beautiful about the hands-on magic that the Spirograph inspires. I bought one for my niece, who loves to color, and it adds to her creativity.
customer_reviews.author: Darren Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Great Gift
customer_reviews.text: This is still after all These years FUN Great gift for all ages
customer_reviews.author: susan wilson

customer_reviews.title: It is very small
customer_reviews.text: it is very small I have been uncomfortable to use. the figures are beautiful, but very small.
customer_reviews.author: Solanye Mass

customer_reviews.title: Spiral your way to creativity
customer_reviews.text: Came in handy case hours of fun creating wonderful shapes.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Janes

customer_reviews.title: Good for any age
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my sons birthday, I’m an artist and we had a lot of fun making these together. It’s a good gift for all my kids ages ranging from 2-12 (we have 5) they all played with it and enjoyed it.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa Ritz

customer_reviews.title: Great gift for a boy or girl- keep one on hand for emergency gift or class parties
customer_reviews.text: This is a small Spirograph set and is perfect for an inexpensive gift. I got it for my daughter to give as her Secret Santa gift and the girl who received it loved it. And it is great for a girl or boy so if you are like me and sometimes buy small things to keep around as "emergency gifts", this would be a great choice. In fact, I am buying another one to keep in my gift stash.
customer_reviews.author: Jana Payne

customer_reviews.title: Great for the creative child
customer_reviews.text: Brings back memories when I was a kid. Daughter has made some great designs. Simple gift for the artist is your family. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: CDN in Hong Kong

product_meta.title: Spirograph Design Tin Set
product_meta.description:
Size:1 Pack (Tin Set)Spirograph is back, and it's better than ever. Your whole family can have hours of creative fun with the amazing Spirograph Design Tin Set. Since it was first introduced in 1965, Spirograph has made it possible for aspiring artists of all ages to create beautifully intricate designs. Originally developed by mechanical engineer Denys Fisher for use as a drafting tool, the Spirograph's distinctive wheels and rings cleverly combine the principles of art and mathematics in a way that has inspired and delighted generations. Now you can create your own cool designs and awesome pictures with this fun Spirograph Design Set, Tin. This set features all the iconic wheels and rings of the original, re-engineered and updated for today. Simply choose from the gears and wheels, put your paper in place, and create whirling, spiraling, mix and match patterns for a totally awesome image. Use the design guide to try out tried and true designs, or get creative and create cool and colorful graphics of your own. Packaged in a convenient tin, the Spirograph Design Set includes 7 Spirograph Precision Wheels, 1 Spirograph Precision Ring, 1 Spirograph Precision Rack, 0.21 ounces of Reusable Spiro-Putty, 2 Retractable Ballpoint Pens, 10-page Guide Book, 24-page Design Pad. It all comes in a collectible travel tin with a snap-in storage tray. For age 8 and up. Brought to you by Kahootz Toys, where we use our skills and passions to bring great kids' products into the world.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Since it was first introduced in 1965, Spirograph has made it possible for aspiring artists of all ages to create beautifully intricate designs, originally developed as a drafting tool, by a mechanical engineer named Denys Fisher, the distinctive wheels and rings of the Spirograph cleverly combine, the principles of art and mathematics in a way that has inspired and delighted generations. Now you too can create your own cool designs and awesome pictures with the help of this fun and classic Spirograph drawing accessory. Put your paper in place and then choose again and again from 19 different gears to mix and match patterns and create a totally awesome image. Use the design guide to try out tried and true designs or get creative and create cool and colorful graphics of your own. Drawing accessory includes tray with built-in storage and includes 7 wheels, 1 gear ring, 1 gear rack, 2 ball point retractable pens, Spiro-Putty, a 12 page design guide and a 24 page, 5"x7" design pad.
feature_bullets: GET READY FOR HOURS OF FUN with the Spirograph Design Tin Set, a must-have for young and old alike
ASPIRING ARTIST OF ALL AGES can draw elegant, spiraling designs with Spirograph's distinctive interlocking gears and wheels
SET INCLUDES - 7 wheels, 1 ring, 1 rack, spiro-putty, 2 pens, 10-page guide book, design paper, stored in a collectible tin with snap-in storage tray
INSPIRED BY THE ORIGINAL 1965 SPIROGRAPH! Brought to you by Kahootz Toys, where we use our all our creative skills and passions to bring exciting, engaging kids' products into a world of play
